key_points: Prince Harry, Meghan Markle, and their son Archie moved to Montecito, California, 13 months ago, causing significant media attention.
Montecito is home to numerous celebrities like Oprah Winfrey and Ellen DeGeneres, who generally live without media intrusion.
The Sussexes bought a $14 million mansion and have been involved in various projects and personal milestones since moving.
The media frenzy around them in Montecito has somewhat subsided according to local sources.
Sightings of the couple are rare; Harry is sometimes seen driving or walking his dog, but Meghan is seldom seen.
Local residents, including celebrities, maintain privacy and don't disclose the Sussexes' location to others.
The Sussex family has a considerable staff for security and household management but maintains a low profile.
Despite their efforts to blend in, the couple's involvement in the local community has been minimal, partly due to the pandemic.
Their presence has sparked curiosity among tourists but hasn't significantly changed the community's dynamics.
Local sentiment towards the couple is sympathetic, offering them privacy, but Meghan's book isn't a bestseller in the community.
spokespersons: 40-year-long waiter at Montecito's village drugstore and cafe
Young man working at Montecito's Upper Village gas station
